info.name: Wavefront Public API v2
info.description:
The Wavefront public API (v2) enables you to interact with Wavefront servers using standard web service API tools. You can use the API to automate commonly executed operations such as automatically tagging sources.

When you make API calls outside the Wavefront API documentation you must add the header "Authorization: Bearer <<API-TOKEN>>" to your HTTP requests.

For legacy versions of the Wavefront API, see the legacy API documentation.

item.name: Alerts
Create a specific alert
Count alerts of various statuses for a customer
Get all alerts for a customer
Get a specific alert
Update a specific alert

Get the version history of a specific alert
Get a specific historical version of a specific alert

Get all tags associated with a specific alert
Set all tags associated with a specific alert
Add a tag to a specific alert
Remove a tag from a specific alert
Undelete a specific alert
Unsnooze a specific alert
Search over a customer's non-deleted alerts
Search over a customer's deleted alerts
Lists the values of one or more facets over the customer's deleted alerts
Lists the values of a specific facet over the customer's deleted alerts
Lists the values of one or more facets over the customer's non-deleted alerts
Lists the values of a specific facet over the customer's non-deleted alerts
Charts
Perform a charting query against Wavefront servers that returns the appropriate points in the specified time window and granularity

request.description: Long time spans and small granularities can take a long time to calculate

item.name: Get more details on a metric, including reporting sources and approximate last time reported
Perform a raw data query against Wavefront servers that returns second granularity points grouped by tags

request.description: An API to check if ingested points are as expected.  Points ingested within a single second are averaged when returned.

request.description: The following fields are readonly and will be ignored when passed in the request: id, isEphemeral, isUserEvent, runningState, canDelete, canClose, creatorType, createdAt, updatedAt, createdEpochMillis, updatedEpochMillis, updaterId, creatorId, and summarizedEvents

body.raw:
Example Body: 
{
  "description": "Notificant Description",
  "template": "POST Body -- Mustache syntax",
  "title": "Email title",
  "triggers": [
    "ALERT_OPENED"
  ],
  "method": "EMAIL",
  "recipient": "value@example.com",
  "emailSubject": "Email subject cannot contain new line"
}
